thread.title: Nadine Lustre Stars In New Film With These Big Stars
thread.title_full: Nadine Lustre Stars In New Film With These Big Stars

author: Jeel Monde
title: Nadine Lustre Stars In New Film With These Big Stars
text:
For the film “Uninvited”, Nadine Lustre will be working with these award-winning actors. NADINE LUSTRE – The award-winning actress comes back for a new film with Star For All Seasons Vilma Santos and Best Actor Aga Muhlach.
Film producers Mentorque Productions and Project 8 Projects will be collaborating on a new film featuring award-winning actors. It created a loud buzz online after the netizens saw the powerhouse cast which is already promising in terms of acting dynamics and cinematic experience.
View this post on Instagram A post shared by Kapamilya Online World (@kowalerts)
It will be headlined by Star For All Seasons Vilma Santos, Gawad Urian Best Actress Nadine Lustre, and 2018 FAP Award Best Actor Aga Muhlach.
They will be joined by other big stars such as Tirso Cruz III, Lotlot De Leon, Mylene Dizon, Gabby Padilla, Gio Alvarez, Cholo Barretto, Ketchup Eusebio, Elijah Canlas, Ron Angeles, and RK Bagatsing. This upcoming movie project is to be directed by Dan Villegas.
Antoinette Jadaone will be producing this. She is also the director behind films such as “Never Not Love You” in 2018, Alone/Together” in 2019, and the 2014 film “That Thing Called Tadhana”.
It will be called “Uninvited” and so far, the details about this film is limited yet.
Meanwhile, her ex-boyfriend James Reid had previously expressed his desire and excitement to act again. He is thrilled about the upcoming projects; however, James expressed no desire to work with Nadine again. He is not interested in being in a love team anymore at all and one of the reasons is his girlfriend Issa Pressman. He wants to respect their relationship.
For a time, while being in a love team, he lost his identity and now that he is back, he would want to avoid it. Dashing out the hopes of their fans for a reunion project from JaDine, he expressed, “I don’t think that’s happening.”
What can you say about this? Let us know in the comments!
